item.title: Model/server/client help (pi) look please maybe you know?
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Not all too familiar with client sided stuff, but why are you giving the item an ‘i’ of 0, when you are labeling the item ID as 12281?
iBunnie, I’m pretty sure that is true, as assigning a value of 0 would mean no value in that ID, which would mean item nothing.

Read full topic

item.title: Model/server/client help (pi) look please maybe you know?
item.dc:creator: @thomashawkins1991 thomashawkins1991
item.description:
@thomashawkins1991 wrote:

i have my models in the raw folder in my cache i never understood the whole model part never messed with it. can someone tell me what im doing wrong? i don’t get any errors at all.
itemdef_2 code)

} if(i == 0) { itemdef.modelID = 12281; itemdef.name = "Brown Wings"; itemdef.modelZoom = 850; itemdef.modelRotation1 = 252; itemdef.modelRotation2 = 1020; itemdef.modelOffset1 = -1; itemdef.modelOffset2 = 24; itemdef.anInt165 = 15008; itemdef.anInt200 = 15008; itemdef.itemActions = new String[5]; itemdef.itemActions[1] = "Wear";
ok now item code

ok i goto the game i type in

nothing spawns this is for all models can i just make up a number? i don’t understand this at all why it wont work?

Read full topic
